user: Why can't I place trades on currency pairs?
standard_answer: Depending on your account type, the related instruments will be displayed with a unique suffix. To understand which instruments are right for your account type, please see below: Premium Account: instruments displayed without a suffix like EURUSD or GBPUSD Zero Account: instruments displayed with 'b' suffix like EURUSDb or GBPUSDb Pro Account : instruments displayed with a 'r' at the end like EURUSDr or GBPUSDr Cent Account: instruments displayed with a 'c' at the end like EURUSDc or GBPUSDc If the related instruments are not visible on your terminal, just follow the steps below: Right-click on the 'Market Watch' window Select 'Symbols' and choose the instruments you want to trade Click on 'Show', then, close the 'Market Watch' window Right-click on the 'Market Watch' window again and select 'Show All' Any greyed-out symbols you might see on the terminal are used to calculate oil prices. If these are confusing for you, you can right-click on them and select 'Hide'.

Steps to archive a trading account: Desktop: Log in to your myHF area from your PC/Laptop In the home tab section under 'My Trading accounts' Select the cog wheel symbol underneath the 'ACTIONS' tab next to your Live Accounts or Demo Accounts Choose 'Archive Account' and click on 'Confirm'. HFM App: Log in to your myHF area from the HFM App Tap on Menu at the bottom left and select My Wallet Select either the 'Live Accounts' or the 'Demo Accounts' tab Tap on the trading account you wish to archive Click on the 3 dotted vertical symbols next to the 'trade' button Tap on 'Archive Account' and confirm Keep in mind that a trading account cannot be reactivated once it is archived.

user: What's the process to archive or deactivate a trading account?
standard_answer: Steps to archive a trading account: Desktop: Log in to your myHF area from your PC/Laptop In the home tab section under 'My Trading accounts' Select the cog wheel symbol underneath the 'ACTIONS' tab next to your Live Accounts or Demo Accounts Choose 'Archive Account' and click on 'Confirm'. HFM App: Log in to your myHF area from the HFM App Tap on Menu at the bottom left and select My Wallet Select either the 'Live Accounts' or the 'Demo Accounts' tab Tap on the trading account you wish to archive Click on the 3 dotted vertical symbols next to the 'trade' button Tap on 'Archive Account' and confirm Keep in mind that a trading account cannot be reactivated once it is archived.

user: What documents do I need to open an account?
standard_answer: For Live accounts, we need at least two documents to accept you as an individual client: Proof of Identification - current (not expired) coloured scanned copy (in PDF or JPG format) of your passport. If no valid passport is available, please upload a similar identification document bearing your photo, such as a National ID card or a Driving licence. Proof of Address - a Bank Statement or Utility Bill. Please ensure, however, that documents provided are not older than 6 months and that your name and physical address are clearly displayed. Important Note: The name on the Proof of Identification document must match the name on the Proof of Address document. You can conveniently upload your documents directly from your myHF area; alternatively, you can also scan them and send them to backoffice@hfm.com Your documents will be checked by the verification department within 48 hours. Kindly note, any deposits will be credited to the account only after your documents have been approved and your myHF area is fully activated.

user: What's the difference between myHF account and trading account?
standard_answer: Your myHF account is your wallet, which is automatically created when you register with HFM. It can be used to make deposits, withdrawals and internal transfers to and from your trading accounts. Through your myHF area, you can also create your live trading accounts and demo accounts. Note: You can log in to your myHF account only from the website or using the HFM App. A trading account is a Live or Demo account you create through your myHF area in order to trade any asset available. user: How do I close my HFM account?
standard_answer: If you wish to close your HFM account, please ensure you have first withdrawn all remaining funds. Once there are no funds left in your HFM account, you can send us an email from your registered email address, confirming you wish to close your HFM account, and including the reason behind your decision for feedback purposes. You can find our email address on our website Contact Us section.

user: How can I change my legal name?
standard_answer: If your name/surname has changed, please send an email from your registered email address to backoffice@hfm.com confirming your new full name and surname, and attaching a valid Proof of Legal Existence (PLE) document confirming the same, as well as a legal document confirming the change (e.g. If your surname changed due to marriage, please provide the marriage certificate).

user: How do I change my residential address?
standard_answer: If you wish to change your registered residential address, please send an email from your registered email address to backoffice@hfm.com confirming your new full residential address and attaching a valid Proof of Address (POA) document confirming the same. Suitable Proof of Address documents include a recent bank statement or utility bill (energy bill, water bill, telephone bill, gas bill) or any other governmental document that is in your name and is no more than 6 months old. Please note that all four corners should be visible.

user: How do I transfer funds between accounts?
standard_answer: In order to transfer funds, please log into your myHF area, select 'Transfer funds' on the left-hand menu. In case you are using the HFM APP, please log in to your myHF account, please select MENU on the bottom left side of the screen, tap on My Wallet and select Transfer funds. You will then be able to select the account from which you wish to transfer and the receiving account. Enter the amount and then click on Continue.

user: How do I change my registered email?

user: How do I reset my trader's password?
standard_answer: How to Change Your Trader's Password For Desktop: Access your myHF area from your PC or Laptop. Navigate to My Trading Accounts: In the Home tab, locate the 'My Trading Accounts' section. Select the Account: Find the Live or Demo account for which you want to change the password. Under the 'ACTIONS' tab, click the cog wheel symbol. Change Password: Choose 'Change Password' from the options. Set New Password: Enter a new password that meets all security criteria, then click 'Continue'. Verify with OTP: You will receive a two-factor authentication (2FA) one-time password (OTP) via your registered email. Enter this OTP in the provided field and click 'Confirm'. For HFM App: Open the HFM App and log in to your myHF area. Access My Wallet: Tap on the Menu and select 'My Wallet'. Select Account: Choose either the 'Live Accounts' or 'Demo Accounts' tab, then tap on the trading account for which you want to change the password. Change Password: Tap the three vertical dots next to the 'Trade' button and select 'Change Password'. Set New Password: Enter a new password that meets all security criteria, then tap 'Continue'. Verify with OTP: You will receive a two-factor authentication (2FA) one-time password (OTP) via your registered email. Enter this OTP in the provided field and click 'Confirm'.

All available withdrawal options can be found on our website by navigating to Trading > Pricing > Withdrawal Options

user: I can't login or register a real account
standard_answer: If you are unable to log in or register a real (live) trading account on HFM, here are some common reasons and solutions: Account Creation Process: You need to create your live trading account through your myHF area. Log in to myHF, then select Open Live Account under the Trading Accounts menu. Make sure to complete all required steps, including setting your trading account password. Verification Requirements: Live accounts require identity verification. Ensure you have submitted valid documents such as Proof of Identification and Proof of Address. Without verification, access to your live account may be restricted. Login Details: When logging in to your live trading account on MT4 or MT5, use your trading account number and the trader's password you created. Also, select the correct server (hfmarkets) during login. Technical Issues: Try clearing your browser cache, using a different device, or updating the HFM App. Also, ensure you are logging in through the correct platforms: myHF area for account management and MT4/MT5 platforms or WebTerminal for trading accounts. If you continue to experience issues, please contact our support team for further assistance: https://www.hfm.com/int/en/contact-us

user: What documents do I need for verification?
standard_answer: For identity verification on HFM, you need to provide the following documents: Proof of Identification: A current (not expired) colored scanned copy of your passport. If you don't have a valid passport, you can submit a similar photo ID such as a National ID card or Driving Licence.Proof of Address: A recent Bank Statement or Utility Bill (energy, water, telephone, gas bill) that is no older than 6 months. The document must clearly show your name and physical address. Important: The name on your Proof of Identification must exactly match the name on your Proof of Address. You can upload these documents directly in your myHF area or send them via email to backoffice@hfm.com. Verification usually takes up to 48 hours.

user: Can I change the base currency?
standard_answer: If you haven't funded your HFM trading account, request a base currency change by emailing from your registered address, specifying the desired currency and your account number. Wait for confirmation before making deposits. If your account is funded, you cannot change the base currency; you'll need to open a new account with your desired currency as the base currency.

user: I deposited with card but want to withdraw to online banking
standard_answer: Funds are withdrawn to the same card used for deposits during the last 6 months. Therefore, if you made a deposit using a bank card, you will need to withdraw funds back to that same card. Withdrawals to online banking or other methods are not available if the deposit was made by card. If you have any issues or need further assistance, feel free to connect with a Live Agent. As per our Company procedure, we must follow a back to source withdrawal priority procedure, meaning all deposits made via card must be returned (in the same amount) back to the same card. Once those are cleared, you may be able to use online banking methods, upon availability.

user: Can I use different deposit and withdrawal methods?
standard_answer: Withdrawals are processed to the same card used for deposits within the last 6 months. This means you need to use the same method for withdrawals as you did for deposits during that period. If you have any further questions or need assistance, feel free to ask! As part of our ongoing anti-money laundering procedures, it is mandatory to withdraw via the same method you deposited. If you have any further questions or need assistance, feel free to ask!

user: How do I withdraw to my bank account?

user: What's the difference between myHF and trading account?
standard_answer: Your myHF account is your wallet, which is automatically created when you register with HFM. It can be used to make deposits, withdrawals and internal transfers to and from your trading accounts. Through your myHF area, you can also create your live trading accounts and demo accounts. Note: You can log in to your myHF account only from the website or using the HFM App. A trading account is a Live or Demo account you create through your myHF area in order to trade any asset available. Note: You can log in to your Live / Demo trading account only on the platform or the WebTerminal.

user: How do I open a live or demo account?

In case you are using the HFM App, please log in to your myHF account, select Menu > My Wallet > Live / Demo Accounts TAB > Open Trading Account. Keep in mind that you will be required to create your own Trading Account Password.

user: Steps to create a new trading account?
standard_answer: To create a trading account, please log into your myHF area; on the left menu under Trading Accounts > Open Live Account or Open Demo account. In case you are using the HFM App, please log in to your myHF account, select Menu > My Wallet > Live / Demo Accounts TAB > Open Trading Account. Keep in mind that you will be required to create your own Trading Account Password.

user: What are the document requirements for account opening?
standard_answer: For Live accounts, we need at least two documents to accept you as an individual client: Proof of Identification - current (not expired) coloured scanned copy (in PDF or JPG format) of your passport. If no valid passport is available, please upload a similar identification document bearing your photo, such as a National ID card or a Driving licence. Proof of Address - a Bank Statement or Utility Bill. Please ensure, however, that documents provided are not older than 6 months and that your name and physical address are clearly displayed. Important Note: The name on the Proof of Identification document must match the name on the Proof of Address document. You can conveniently upload your documents directly from your myHF area; alternatively, you can also scan them and send them to backoffice@hfm.com Your documents will be checked by the verification department within 48 hours. Kindly note, any deposits will be credited to the account only after your documents have been approved and your myHF area is fully activated.

HF Markets (DIFC) Ltd is authorised and regulated by the Dubai Financial Services Authority (DFSA) under license number F004885. HF Markets (UK) Ltd is authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) under firm reference number 801701.

A true 24-hour market, Forex trading begins each day in Sydney, and moves around the globe as the business day begins in each financial center, first to Tokyo, then London, and New York. Unlike any other financial market, investors can respond to currency fluctuations caused by economic, social and political events at the time they occur - day or night. The market is open 24/5.

user: What does long and short position mean?
standard_answer: If you are buying currency, you are opening a 'long' position, if selling - 'short'. For example, if you buy 1 lot of EUR/USD, it means you open a long position for 100000 of EUR against USD. And if you sell 10 lots of USD/CAD that means you open short position for 1 milion of USD versus CAD.

user: Can you explain long vs short positions?
standard_answer: If you are buying currency, you are opening a 'long' position, if selling - 'short'. For example, if you buy 1 lot of EUR/USD, it means you open a long position for 100000 of EUR against USD. And if you sell 10 lots of USD/CAD that means you open short position for 1 milion of USD versus CAD.

user: How do I change my account base currency?
standard_answer: If you have not yet funded your HFM account/Live trading account, please send an email from your registered email address with your request based on the email address provided via our page here https://www.hfm.com/int/en/contact-us, specifying the base currency you wish to have on your account, and kindly confirm the account number. Please do not make any deposits until you have received confirmation that the change has been made successfully. If you have already funded your account, unfortunately, it is not possible to change the base currency.

user: Can I switch the base currency of my wallet?

Please do not make any deposits until you have received confirmation that the change has been made successfully. If you have already funded your account, unfortunately, it is not possible to change the base currency.

Depending on your account type, the related instruments will be displayed with a unique suffix. To understand which instruments are right for your account type, please see below: Premium Account: instruments displayed without a suffix like EURUSD or GBPUSD Zero Account: instruments displayed with 'b' suffix like EURUSDb or GBPUSDb Pro Account : instruments displayed with a 'r' at the end like EURUSDr or GBPUSDr Cent Account: instruments displayed with a 'c' at the end like EURUSDc or GBPUSDc If the related instruments are not visible on your terminal, just follow the steps below: Right-click on the 'Market Watch' window Select 'Symbols' and choose the instruments you want to trade Click on 'Show', then, close the 'Market Watch' window Right-click on the 'Market Watch' window again and select 'Show All' Any greyed-out symbols you might see on the terminal are used to calculate oil prices. If these are confusing for you, you can right-click on them and select 'Hide'.

If these are confusing for you, you can right-click on them and select 'Hide'.

Please be informed that based on our RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH TRANSACTIONS IN DERIVATIVE FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS (CFDS) policy, the maximum leverage for a trading account shall be automatically adjusted without any prior notice to the Client by taking into consideration the trading account's equity (i.e. Balance + Floating Profit & Loss + Swap + Commission) based on the below: Trading Account's Equity (USD) Maximum Leverage: 0.00-4999.99 = 1:2000, 5000.00-39999.99 = 1:1000, 40000.00-99999.99 = 1:500, 100000.00 or more = 1:200. Cent Accounts (Excluding Copy Cent): 0.00-499.99 = 1:2000, 500.00-999.99 = 1:1000, 1000-1499.99 = 1:500, 1500.00 or more = 1:200

user: Steps to archive my trading account?
standard_answer: Steps to archive a trading account: Desktop: Log in to your myHF area from your PC/Laptop In the home tab section under 'My Trading accounts' Select the cog wheel symbol underneath the 'ACTIONS' tab next to your Live Accounts or Demo Accounts Choose 'Archive Account' and click on 'Confirm'. HFM App: Log in to your myHF area from the HFM App Tap on Menu at the bottom left and select My Wallet Select either the 'Live Accounts' or the 'Demo Accounts' tab Tap on the trading account you wish to archive Click on the 3 dotted vertical symbols next to the 'trade' button Tap on 'Archive Account' and confirm Keep in mind that a trading account cannot be reactivated once it is archived.

user: How do I archive an account?

HFM App: Log in to your myHF area from the HFM App Tap on Menu at the bottom left and select My Wallet Select either the 'Live Accounts' or the 'Demo Accounts' tab Tap on the trading account you wish to archive Click on the 3 dotted vertical symbols next to the 'trade' button Tap on 'Archive Account' and confirm Keep in mind that a trading account cannot be reactivated once it is archived.

user: How do I update my legal name?
standard_answer: If your name/surname has changed, please send an email from your registered email address to backoffice@hfm.com confirming your new full name and surname, and attaching a valid Proof of Legal Existence (PLE) document confirming the same, as well as a legal document confirming the change (e.g. If your surname changed due to marriage, please provide the marriage certificate).

user: How to update my residential address?
standard_answer: If you wish to change your registered residential address, please send an email from your registered email address to backoffice@hfm.com confirming your new full residential address and attaching a valid Proof of Address (POA) document confirming the same. Suitable Proof of Address documents include a recent bank statement or utility bill or any other governmental document that is in your name and is no more than 6 months old. Please note that all four corners should be visible.

HFM offers leverage up to 1:2000, depending on your account type and equity level. Leverage is dynamically adjusted based on your account equity: 0-$4,999 = 1:2000, $5,000-$39,999 = 1:1000, $40,000-$99,999 = 1:500, $100,000+ = 1:200. For Cent accounts, the thresholds are proportionally lower.

Forex trading is available 24 hours a day, 5 days a week. The market opens on Sunday at 5 PM EST and closes on Friday at 5 PM EST. Trading begins each day in Sydney, moves to Tokyo, then London, and finally New York. Unlike other financial markets, you can respond to currency fluctuations caused by economic, social and political events as they occur.

user: When is the forex market open?

No, forex and CFD markets are closed on weekends. Trading is available Monday through Friday only. The market closes on Friday at 5 PM EST and reopens on Sunday at 5 PM EST. However, you can still access your myHF area, make deposits, withdrawals, and manage your account during weekends.

No, forex and CFD markets are closed on weekends. Trading is available Monday through Friday only. The market closes on Friday at 5 PM EST and reopens on Sunday at 5 PM EST. However, you can still access your myHF area, make deposits, withdrawals, and manage your account during weekends.

For account opening, you need two main documents: 1) Proof of Identification - a current colored copy of your passport, National ID card, or driving license, and 2) Proof of Address - a recent bank statement or utility bill not older than 6 months showing your name and address. The name on both documents must match exactly. Upload them in your myHF area or email to backoffice@hfm.com.

You can download MT4/MT5 from our website at https://www.hfm.com/int/en/platforms or directly from your myHF area under Trading Platforms. We offer desktop versions for Windows/Mac, mobile apps for iOS/Android, and WebTerminal for browser-based trading. Choose the platform that best suits your trading needs and device.

The spread is the difference between the bid price (selling price) and ask price (buying price) of a currency pair. It represents the cost of trading and is how brokers make money. For example, if EUR/USD shows 1.1000/1.1002, the spread is 2 pips. HFM offers competitive spreads starting from 0.0 pips on major pairs with our Zero account.

To place a trade, open your MT4/MT5 platform, right-click on a currency pair in Market Watch, select 'New Order', choose Buy or Sell, set your volume (lot size), add Stop Loss and Take Profit if desired, and click 'Buy' or 'Sell'. You can also double-click on a currency pair for quick order entry. Always review your order details before confirming.

To place a trade, open your MT4/MT5 platform, right-click on a currency pair in Market Watch, select 'New Order', choose Buy or Sell, set your volume (lot size), add Stop Loss and Take Profit if desired, and click 'Buy' or 'Sell'. You can also double-click on a currency pair for quick order entry. Always review your order details before confirming.

Stop Loss is an order that automatically closes your trade at a predetermined loss level to limit potential losses. Take Profit automatically closes your trade when it reaches your target profit level. Both are essential risk management tools. You can set them when opening a trade or modify existing positions. They help you manage risk without constantly monitoring the markets.

They help you manage risk without constantly monitoring the markets.

Yes, HFM supports Expert Advisors (EAs) on MT4 and MT5 platforms. EAs are automated trading programs that can execute trades based on predefined strategies. To use EAs, enable 'Allow automated trading' in your platform settings, install the EA file, and attach it to a chart. Make sure you understand the EA's strategy and risk before using it with real money.

Yes, HFM supports Expert Advisors (EAs) on MT4 and MT5 platforms. EAs are automated trading programs that can execute trades based on predefined strategies. To use EAs, enable 'Allow automated trading' in your platform settings, install the EA file, and attach it to a chart. Make sure you understand the EA's strategy and risk before using it with real money.

HFM offers a wide range of trading instruments including: Forex (major, minor, and exotic currency pairs), Indices (US30, SPX500, UK100, etc.), Commodities (Gold, Silver, Oil), Cryptocurrencies (Bitcoin, Ethereum, etc.), and Stocks. The exact instruments available depend on your account type and region. Check your trading platform for the complete list.

The exact instruments available depend on your account type and region. Check your trading platform for the complete list.

To close a trade, go to the 'Trade' tab in your MT4/MT5 platform, find your open position, right-click on it and select 'Close Order', or simply click the 'X' button next to the position. You can also close trades by placing an opposite order of the same size. On mobile apps, tap on the position and select 'Close Trade'.

To close a trade, go to the 'Trade' tab in your MT4/MT5 platform, find your open position, right-click on it and select 'Close Order', or simply click the 'X' button next to the position. You can also close trades by placing an opposite order of the same size. On mobile apps, tap on the position and select 'Close Trade'.

Margin is the required deposit to open a leveraged position. It's calculated as: Position Size ÷ Leverage. Free Margin is the amount available to open new positions, calculated as: Equity - Used Margin. When Free Margin reaches zero, you cannot open new trades. If Margin Level falls below 100%, you may receive a margin call warning.

Margin is the required deposit to open a leveraged position. It's calculated as: Position Size ÷ Leverage. Free Margin is the amount available to open new positions, calculated as: Equity - Used Margin. When Free Margin reaches zero, you cannot open new trades. If Margin Level falls below 100%, you may receive a margin call warning.

user: What happens in a margin call?
standard_answer: A margin call occurs when your Margin Level falls below 100%, meaning your losses are approaching your available margin. You'll receive a warning to either deposit more funds or close some positions to reduce risk. If Margin Level reaches 50% (Stop Out level), the system will automatically start closing your losing positions to protect your account from further losses.

A margin call occurs when your Margin Level falls below 100%, meaning your losses are approaching your available margin. You'll receive a warning to either deposit more funds or close some positions to reduce risk. If Margin Level reaches 50% (Stop Out level), the system will automatically start closing your losing positions to protect your account from further losses.

Forex charts show price movements over time. Key elements include: Candlesticks (show open, high, low, close prices), Time frames (1min to monthly), Support/Resistance levels (price barriers), and Technical indicators (moving averages, RSI, etc.). Green/white candles indicate price increases, red/black candles show decreases. Start with basic chart reading before using advanced technical analysis.

Forex charts show price movements over time. Green/white candles indicate price increases, red/black candles show decreases. Start with basic chart reading before using advanced technical analysis.

Slippage occurs when your trade is executed at a different price than expected, usually during high volatility or low liquidity periods. For example, if you place a buy order at 1.1000 but it executes at 1.1002, that's 2 pips of slippage. While slippage cannot be completely avoided, HFM's fast execution and deep liquidity help minimize it.

Slippage occurs when your trade is executed at a different price than expected, usually during high volatility or low liquidity periods. For example, if you place a buy order at 1.1000 but it executes at 1.1002, that's 2 pips of slippage. While slippage cannot be completely avoided, HFM's fast execution and deep liquidity help minimize it.

A pip (percentage in point) is the smallest price movement in a currency pair, typically the fourth decimal place. For most pairs like EUR/USD, 1 pip = 0.0001. For JPY pairs, 1 pip = 0.01. Pips are used to measure price changes and calculate profits/losses. For example, if EUR/USD moves from 1.1000 to 1.1010, that's a 10-pip movement.

A pip (percentage in point) is the smallest price movement in a currency pair, typically the fourth decimal place. For most pairs like EUR/USD, 1 pip = 0.0001. For JPY pairs, 1 pip = 0.01. Pips are used to measure price changes and calculate profits/losses. For example, if EUR/USD moves from 1.1000 to 1.1010, that's a 10-pip movement.

user: How to calculate profit and loss?
standard_answer: Profit/Loss = (Close Price - Open Price) × Position Size × Pip Value. For buy positions, profit occurs when close price > open price. For sell positions, profit occurs when close price < open price. Your trading platform automatically calculates P&L in real-time. Remember to account for spread costs when calculating net profit.

Profit/Loss = (Close Price - Open Price) × Position Size × Pip Value. For buy positions, profit occurs when close price > open price. For sell positions, profit occurs when close price < open price. Your trading platform automatically calculates P&L in real-time. Remember to account for spread costs when calculating net profit.

Hedging involves opening opposite positions to reduce risk exposure. For example, if you're long EUR/USD, you might short EUR/GBP to hedge against EUR weakness. HFM allows hedging on the same instrument (going long and short simultaneously). While hedging can limit losses, it also caps potential profits and increases trading costs.

Yes, HFM offers mobile trading apps for iOS and Android devices. Download the MT4 or MT5 mobile app, log in with your trading account credentials, and trade on-the-go. user: Difference between demo and live account?
standard_answer: Demo accounts use virtual money for practice trading without financial risk, while live accounts use real money. Demo accounts help you learn the platform and test strategies. However, demo trading lacks emotional pressure of real money. Live accounts require minimum deposits and full verification. Start with demo to practice, then transition to live when confident.

In MT4/MT5, go to File > Login to Trade Account, enter different account credentials. On mobile apps, tap the account number at the top and select another account. Copy trading allows you to automatically copy trades from experienced traders. HFM offers copy trading services where you can browse trader profiles, view their performance history, and allocate funds to copy their strategies. You maintain control over risk settings and can stop copying anytime. It's useful for beginners or those with limited time.

To enable 2FA, log into your myHF area, go to Security Settings, and follow the setup instructions. You'll typically need to download an authenticator app (Google Authenticator, Authy), scan a QR code, and enter a verification code. 2FA adds extra security by requiring both your password and a time-based code from your phone.

Yes, you can have up to 7 live MT4 accounts and 5 live MT5 accounts. Each account can have different settings (leverage, account type, base currency). To create additional accounts, log into your myHF area and select 'Open Live Account'. If you reach the limit, you'll need to archive existing accounts to create new ones.

user: How many trading accounts can I open?
standard_answer: Yes, you can have up to 7 live MT4 accounts and 5 live MT5 accounts. Each account can have different settings (leverage, account type, base currency). To create additional accounts, log into your myHF area and select 'Open Live Account'. If you reach the limit, you'll need to archive existing accounts to create new ones.

MT4 is the classic platform focused on forex trading with simple interface and wide EA support. MT5 is newer with more advanced features: additional timeframes, more order types, economic calendar, market depth, and better backtesting. MT5 supports more asset classes. Choose MT4 for simplicity and EA compatibility, MT5 for advanced features.

user: What's the difference between MT4 and MT5?
standard_answer: MT4 is the classic platform focused on forex trading with simple interface and wide EA support. MT5 is newer with more advanced features: additional timeframes, more order types, economic calendar, market depth, and better backtesting. MT5 supports more asset classes. Choose MT4 for simplicity and EA compatibility, MT5 for advanced features.

Download the indicator file (.ex4 or .mq4), open MT4/MT5, go to File > Open Data Folder > MQL4 (or MQL5) > Indicators, paste the file there, restart the platform. The indicator will appear in Navigator > Indicators > Custom. Drag it onto a chart to use. For MT5, files go in MQL5 > Indicators folder.

user: Steps to add indicators to MT4?
standard_answer: Download the indicator file (.ex4 or .mq4), open MT4/MT5, go to File > Open Data Folder > MQL4 (or MQL5) > Indicators, paste the file there, restart the platform. The indicator will appear in Navigator > Indicators > Custom. Drag it onto a chart to use. For MT5, files go in MQL5 > Indicators folder.

Economic calendar shows scheduled economic events that can impact currency prices (interest rate decisions, employment data, GDP releases). High-impact events are marked in red and can cause significant volatility. Use it to plan trades, avoid trading during major news, or position for expected market movements. Available in MT5 and on our website.

Economic calendar shows scheduled economic events that can impact currency prices (interest rate decisions, employment data, GDP releases). Available in MT5 and on our website.

In MT4/MT5, right-click on a chart, select 'Create Alert', set your price level and notification type (popup, email, sound). You can also set alerts in the mobile app. Alerts notify you when price reaches specific levels without keeping the platform open constantly. Useful for monitoring multiple instruments or waiting for entry/exit points.

user: Setting up alerts for price levels?
standard_answer: In MT4/MT5, right-click on a chart, select 'Create Alert', set your price level and notification type (popup, email, sound). You can also set alerts in the mobile app. Alerts notify you when price reaches specific levels without keeping the platform open constantly. Useful for monitoring multiple instruments or waiting for entry/exit points.

Swap-free (Islamic) accounts don't charge or pay overnight interest on positions held past market close, complying with Islamic finance principles. Instead of swap, a small administration fee may apply to long-term positions. Available for clients following Muslim faith. To request swap-free account, contact support with your requirements.

Swap-free (Islamic) accounts don't charge or pay overnight interest on positions held past market close, complying with Islamic finance principles. Instead of swap, a small administration fee may apply to long-term positions. Available for clients following Muslim faith. To request swap-free account, contact support with your requirements.

The trading terminal shows: Market Watch (instrument prices), Charts (price movements), Trade tab (open positions), Account History (closed trades), Navigator (indicators, EAs), and Toolbox (account info, alerts). Key account info includes Balance (deposited funds), Equity (current account value), Margin (used for positions), and Free Margin (available for new trades).

The trading terminal shows: Market Watch (instrument prices), Charts (price movements), Trade tab (open positions), Account History (closed trades), Navigator (indicators, EAs), and Toolbox (account info, alerts). Key account info includes Balance (deposited funds), Equity (current account value), Margin (used for positions), and Free Margin (available for new trades).

Forex trading involves significant risks: Market risk (price movements against you), Leverage risk (amplifies both profits and losses), Liquidity risk (difficulty closing positions), Interest rate risk (swap charges), and Operational risk (platform/connection issues). Never trade money you can't afford to lose. Use proper risk management, stop losses, and position sizing.

If your account appears disabled, it might be due to reaching the maximum number of live trading accounts allowed (7 accounts). To open a new account, you may need to archive one or more existing accounts first. To archive an account: log in to your myHF area, go to 'My Trading Accounts', select the cog wheel next to the account, and choose 'Archive Account'. Once archived, you can open a new account under Trading Accounts > Open Live Account. If you continue to experience issues, please provide a screenshot of any error and speak to one of our Live Agents.

If your account appears disabled, it might be due to reaching the maximum number of live trading accounts allowed (7 accounts). To open a new account, you may need to archive one or more existing accounts first. Once archived, you can open a new account under Trading Accounts > Open Live Account. If you continue to experience issues, please provide a screenshot of any error and speak to one of our Live Agents.
If you have reached the maximum limits of 7 Live MT4/ 5 Live MT5 trading accounts, kindly archive one (or more) of your existing accounts to be able to open a new one.

Your myHF account is your wallet, which is automatically created when you register with HFM. It can be used to make deposits, withdrawals and internal transfers to and from your trading accounts. Through your myHF area, you can also create your live trading accounts and demo accounts. Note: You can log in to your myHF account only from the website or using the HFM App. A trading account is a Live or Demo account you create through your myHF area in order to trade any asset available. Note: You can log in to your Live / Demo trading account only on the platform or the WebTerminal.

user: Difference between wallet and trading account

Note: You can log in to your myHF account only from the website or using the HFM App. A trading account is a Live or Demo account you create through your myHF area in order to trade any asset available. Note: You can log in to your Live / Demo trading account only on the platform or the WebTerminal.

If you wish to close your HFM account, please ensure you have first withdrawn all remaining funds. Once there are no funds left in your HFM account, you can send us an email from your registered email address, confirming you wish to close your HFM account, and including the reason behind your decision for feedback purposes. You can find our email address on our website Contact Us section.

If you wish to close your HFM account, please ensure you have first withdrawn all remaining funds. Once there are no funds left in your HFM account, you can send us an email from your registered email address, confirming you wish to close your HFM account, and including the reason behind your decision for feedback purposes. You can find our email address on our website Contact Us section.

If your name/surname has changed, please send an email from your registered email address to backoffice@hfm.com confirming your new full name and surname, and attaching a valid Proof of Legal Existence (PLE) document confirming the same, as well as a legal document confirming the change (e.g. If your surname changed due to marriage, please provide the marriage certificate).

If your name/surname has changed, please send an email from your registered email address to backoffice@hfm.com confirming your new full name and surname, and attaching a valid Proof of Legal Existence (PLE) document confirming the same, as well as a legal document confirming the change (e.g. If your surname changed due to marriage, please provide the marriage certificate).

If you wish to change your registered residential address, please send an email from your registered email address to backoffice@hfm.com confirming your new full residential address and attaching a valid Proof of Address (POA) document confirming the same. Suitable Proof of Address documents include a recent bank statement or utility bill (energy bill, water bill, telephone bill, gas bill) or any other governmental document that is in your name and is no more than 6 months old. Please note that all four corners should be visible.

If you wish to change your registered residential address, please send an email from your registered email address to backoffice@hfm.com confirming your new full residential address and attaching a valid Proof of Address (POA) document confirming the same. Suitable Proof of Address documents include a recent bank statement or utility bill (energy bill, water bill, telephone bill, gas bill) or any other governmental document that is in your name and is no more than 6 months old. Please note that all four corners should be visible.

To create a trading account, please log into your myHF area; on the left menu under Trading Accounts > Open Live Account or Open Demo account. In case you are using the HFM App, please log in to your myHF account, select Menu > My Wallet > Live / Demo Accounts TAB > Open Trading Account. Keep in mind that you will be required to create your own Trading Account Password.

To create a trading account, please log into your myHF area; on the left menu under Trading Accounts > Open Live Account or Open Demo account. In case you are using the HFM App, please log in to your myHF account, select Menu > My Wallet > Live / Demo Accounts TAB > Open Trading Account. Keep in mind that you will be required to create your own Trading Account Password.

You can top up or remove funds to/from your demo account anytime you wish, directly from your myHF area by following the steps below: Log in to your myHF area Under your 'My Trading Accounts', click on 'View All' Click on the 'Demo Accounts' tab Select 'Add or Remove funds' and proceed with the adjustment you wish to make

You can top up or remove funds to/from your demo account anytime you wish, directly from your myHF area by following the steps below: Log in to your myHF area Under your 'My Trading Accounts', click on 'View All' Click on the 'Demo Accounts' tab Select 'Add or Remove funds' and proceed with the adjustment you wish to make

To see all your finances, please follow the steps below: Log in to your myHF area On the left-hand side, select My Wallet> Wallet Actions >Wallet Finances Select the tab you wish to view: Deposit/ Withdrawals

To see all your finances, please follow the steps below: Log in to your myHF area On the left-hand side, select My Wallet> Wallet Actions >Wallet Finances Select the tab you wish to view: Deposit/ Withdrawals

In order to transfer funds, please log into your myHF area, select 'Transfer funds' on the left-hand menu. You will then be able to select the account from which you wish to transfer and the receiving account. Enter the amount and then click on Transfer Funds. In case you are using the HFM APP, please log in to your myHF account, please select MENU on the bottom left side of the screen, tap on My Wallet and select Transfer funds. You will then be able to select the account from which you wish to transfer and the receiving account. Enter the amount and then click on Continue.

In order to transfer funds, please log into your myHF area, select 'Transfer funds' on the left-hand menu. You will then be able to select the account from which you wish to transfer and the receiving account. Enter the amount and then click on Transfer Funds. In case you are using the HFM APP, please log in to your myHF account, please select MENU on the bottom left side of the screen, tap on My Wallet and select Transfer funds. You will then be able to select the account from which you wish to transfer and the receiving account. Enter the amount and then click on Continue.

Please log in to your myHF area, on the left-hand side menu, click on deposit, select your preferred method and follow the instructions on the screen. In case you are using the HFM APP, you will need to tap on Menu and then Deposit at the bottom of the screen and select any of the available methods. You will be able to deposit into your myWallet or directly to an active Trading Account.

Please log in to your myHF area, on the left-hand side menu, click on deposit, select your preferred method and follow the instructions on the screen. In case you are using the HFM APP, you will need to tap on Menu and then Deposit at the bottom of the screen and select any of the available methods. You will be able to deposit into your myWallet or directly to an active Trading Account.

To change your myHF area password, please log into your myHF area, under Funding on the left-hand menu, click on myWallet > Wallet Actions > Change Password. You will then need to enter your old password, the new password and repeat your new password and select 'Change Password' to confirm the change.

To change your myHF area password, please log into your myHF area, under Funding on the left-hand menu, click on myWallet > Wallet Actions > Change Password. You will then need to enter your old password, the new password and repeat your new password and select 'Change Password' to confirm the change.

Kindly be informed that the request to change your email address must be sent from the email address registered with your HFM account and should include the new email address you wish to update your account with. If you no longer have access to your registered email address, we kindly ask you to send your request via email to the email address found on the Contact Us section of our website, from your new email address. Please include the following as part of the verification process: A front and Back copy of your registered ID document. A clear photo of yourself holding your registered ID document. (Ensure that both your face and the ID document are fully visible in the picture.) Confirm your old email address. This will help us verify your identity and update our records accordingly.

If you have not yet funded your HFM account/Live trading account, please send us an email to the email address found on the Contact Us section of our website, from your registered email address with your request, specifying the base currency you wish to have on your account, and kindly confirm the account number. Please do not make any deposits until you have received confirmation that the change has been made successfully. If you have already funded your account, unfortunately, it is not possible to change the base currency.

If you have not yet funded your HFM account/Live trading account, please send us an email to the email address found on the Contact Us section of our website, from your registered email address with your request, specifying the base currency you wish to have on your account, and kindly confirm the account number. Please do not make any deposits until you have received confirmation that the change has been made successfully. If you have already funded your account, unfortunately, it is not possible to change the base currency.

How to Change Your Trader's Password For Desktop: Access your myHF area from your PC or Laptop. Navigate to My Trading Accounts: In the Home tab, locate the 'My Trading Accounts' section. Select the Account: Find the Live or Demo account for which you want to change the password. Under the 'ACTIONS' tab, click the cog wheel symbol. Change Password: Choose 'Change Password' from the options. Set New Password: Enter a new password that meets all security criteria, then click 'Continue'. Verify with OTP: You will receive a two-factor authentication (2FA) one-time password (OTP) via your registered email. Enter this OTP in the provided field and click 'Confirm'. For HFM App: Open the HFM App and log in to your myHF area. Access My Wallet: Tap on the Menu and select 'My Wallet'. Select Account: Choose either the 'Live Accounts' or 'Demo Accounts' tab, then tap on the trading account for which you want to change the password. Change Password: Tap the three vertical dots next to the 'Trade' button and select 'Change Password'. Set New Password: Enter a new password that meets all security criteria, then tap 'Continue'. Verify with OTP: You will receive a two-factor authentication (2FA) one-time password (OTP) via your registered email. Enter this OTP in the provided field and click 'Confirm'.

How to Change Your Trader's Password For Desktop: Access your myHF area from your PC or Laptop. Navigate to My Trading Accounts: In the Home tab, locate the 'My Trading Accounts' section. Select the Account: Find the Live or Demo account for which you want to change the password. Under the 'ACTIONS' tab, click the cog wheel symbol. Change Password: Choose 'Change Password' from the options. Set New Password: Enter a new password that meets all security criteria, then click 'Continue'. Verify with OTP: You will receive a two-factor authentication (2FA) one-time password (OTP) via your registered email. Enter this OTP in the provided field and click 'Confirm'. For HFM App: Open the HFM App and log in to your myHF area. Access My Wallet: Tap on the Menu and select 'My Wallet'. Select Account: Choose either the 'Live Accounts' or 'Demo Accounts' tab, then tap on the trading account for which you want to change the password. Change Password: Tap the three vertical dots next to the 'Trade' button and select 'Change Password'. Set New Password: Enter a new password that meets all security criteria, then tap 'Continue'. Verify with OTP: You will receive a two-factor authentication (2FA) one-time password (OTP) via your registered email. Enter this OTP in the provided field and click 'Confirm'.

If you are trying to make a deposit and receive the error message Unsuccessful deposit, please contact your bank for clarification. If you still require assistance regarding your deposit, please email our Deposit Department at deposit@hfm.com

You can also check your deposit status by logging into your myHF area, selecting My Wallet on the left-hand menu, and viewing the Deposit tab to see your recent transactions. A frozen or archived Cent account cannot be reactivated or recovered once it has been archived. If you have archived your Cent account, this action is permanent. You would need to open a new account if you wish to trade again. If you believe your account was frozen in error, please contact our support team for clarification.

A correct password should meet all security criteria, which typically include: A mix of uppercase and lowercase letters, at least one number, at least one special character (e.g., !, @, #, $), and minimum length of 8 characters or more. For example: StrongPass123! When creating your password, make sure it follows these rules to ensure your account security.

A correct password should meet all security criteria, which typically include: A mix of uppercase and lowercase letters, at least one number, at least one special character (e.g., !, @, #, $), and minimum length of 8 characters or more. For example: StrongPass123! When creating your password, make sure it follows these rules to ensure your account security.

Your password might be rejected if it does not meet the required security criteria. When changing your trader's password, make sure it meets all security requirements (such as length, use of uppercase/lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters), is entered correctly without typos, and matches the confirmation password field. If you are changing your password via the myHF area or the HFM App, you will also need to verify the change by entering a one-time password (OTP) sent to your registered email. Ensure you enter the OTP correctly to complete the process. If you continue to experience issues, please contact our support team for assistance.

If your account was terminated during the verification process, this could be due to incomplete or rejected verification documents, failure to meet regulatory requirements, or other compliance issues. Please check your registered email for any notifications from our verification team explaining the reason. For specific details about your account termination and potential resolution, please contact our support team at the email address found on our Contact Us page, as they can review your case individually and provide detailed information about the termination reason.

To deactivate a trading account, you can archive it through your myHF area. On Desktop: Log in to myHF area, find your account under 'My Trading Accounts', click the cog wheel under 'ACTIONS', and select 'Archive Account'. On HFM App: Go to Menu > My Wallet, select your account, tap the three dots next to 'Trade', and tap 'Archive Account'. Important: Once archived, the account cannot be reactivated. If you want to close your entire HFM account, first withdraw all funds, then email us from your registered address via our Contact Us page confirming your request and reason for closure.

To deactivate a trading account, you can archive it through your myHF area. On Desktop: Log in to myHF area, find your account under 'My Trading Accounts', click the cog wheel under 'ACTIONS', and select 'Archive Account'. On HFM App: Go to Menu > My Wallet, select your account, tap the three dots next to 'Trade', and tap 'Archive Account'. Important: Once archived, the account cannot be reactivated. If you want to close your entire HFM account, first withdraw all funds, then email us from your registered address via our Contact Us page confirming your request and reason for closure.

To restore the Market Watch screen in your trading terminal: Right-click on the Market Watch window, select 'Symbols' and choose the instruments you want to trade, click 'Show', then close the Market Watch window. Right-click again on Market Watch and select 'Show All'. If you see greyed-out symbols, you can right-click and select 'Hide' to remove them. If you continue to have issues with your trading platform, please contact our Live Agents for technical assistance.

To restore the Market Watch screen in your trading terminal: Right-click on the Market Watch window, select 'Symbols' and choose the instruments you want to trade, click 'Show', then close the Market Watch window. Right-click again on Market Watch and select 'Show All'. If you see greyed-out symbols, you can right-click and select 'Hide' to remove them. If you continue to have issues with your trading platform, please contact our Live Agents for technical assistance.

Para maibalik ang screen ng Market Watch sa inyong trading terminal: I-right click ang Market Watch window, piliin ang 'Symbols' at piliin ang mga instrumento na gusto ninyong i-trade, i-click ang 'Show', pagkatapos isara ang Market Watch window. I-right click muli ang Market Watch at piliin ang 'Show All'. Kung may mga greyed-out na simbolo, maaari ninyong i-right click at piliin ang 'Hide'. Kung patuloy pa rin ang problema sa inyong trading platform, makipag-ugnayan sa aming Live Agents para sa technical assistance.

HFM is a unified brand name of the HF Markets Group, a global online trading provider offering access to Forex, Commodities, Indices, Shares, and Cryptocurrencies. We provide trading services through popular platforms like MT4 and MT5, with competitive spreads and leverage up to 1:2000. HFM is regulated by multiple financial authorities worldwide including CySEC, FCA, FSCA, and others, ensuring a secure and reliable trading environment for our clients.

user: Why can't I withdraw through online banking
standard_answer: If you cannot withdraw through online banking, please check: Your account is fully verified with all required documents approved, you have sufficient available funds not tied to open trades or margin requirements, and your withdrawal method matches your deposit method if required. Withdrawals are processed within 24 hours, but bank processing times vary. You can check your withdrawal status in myHF area under My Wallet > Wallet Actions > Wallet Finances > Withdrawals tab. If you continue to experience issues or need account-specific assistance, please contact our Live Agents with your account details and any error messages you receive.

If you cannot withdraw through online banking, please check: Your account is fully verified with all required documents approved, you have sufficient available funds not tied to open trades or margin requirements, and your withdrawal method matches your deposit method if required. Withdrawals are processed within 24 hours, but bank processing times vary. You can check your withdrawal status in myHF area under My Wallet > Wallet Actions > Wallet Finances > Withdrawals tab. If you continue to experience issues or need account-specific assistance, please contact our Live Agents with your account details and any error messages you receive.

user: Do you have zero swap fee
standard_answer: HFM offers swap-free trading conditions on specific trading accounts for clients who observe Sharia law, however, several instruments may face Carry Charges after a position has been rolled over for sequential period of days. Swap-free trading conditions are also available for clients who do not observe Sharia law, on specific trading accounts and specific instruments. For detailed information about swap-free accounts and which instruments are eligible, please contact our Live Agents who can provide specific details based on your trading requirements.

user: How to log in on MT5
standard_answer: To log in to MT5, you need your trading account number, trader's password, and server details. For PC/WebTerminal: Open MT5, click 'File' > 'Login to Trade Account', enter your account number and password, choose the server, and click 'Login'. For Android: Open MT5, tap the 3 lines menu, select 'Manage Accounts', tap the + sign, choose 'Login to an existing account', type 'hfmarkets', select the server, enter your account details, and tap 'Sign in'. For iPhone: Open MT5, go to 'Settings' > 'New Account' > 'Login to an existing account', enter 'hfmarkets', choose the server, enter your credentials, and tap 'Sign in'. If you need help with login credentials, contact our Live Agents.

To log in to MT5, you need your trading account number, trader's password, and server details. For iPhone: Open MT5, go to 'Settings' > 'New Account' > 'Login to an existing account', enter 'hfmarkets', choose the server, enter your credentials, and tap 'Sign in'. If you need help with login credentials, contact our Live Agents.

user: HFM app won't open what is PIN
standard_answer: Maaaring hindi nagbubukas ang inyong HFM app dahil sa maling PIN o iba pang teknikal na isyu. Ang tamang PIN ay ang password na inyong itinakda para sa inyong trading account. Kung nais ninyong baguhin o i-reset ang inyong trader's password (PIN): Buksan ang HFM App at mag-login sa inyong myHF area, pumunta sa Menu at piliin ang 'My Wallet', piliin ang 'Live Accounts' o 'Demo Accounts', tapos piliin ang trading account na gusto ninyong baguhin ang password, i-tap ang tatlong patayong tuldok sa tabi ng 'Trade' button at piliin ang 'Change Password', maglagay ng bagong password na sumusunod sa security criteria, tapos i-tap ang 'Continue', makakatanggap kayo ng OTP sa inyong registered email, ilagay ito sa field at i-tap ang 'Confirm'. Kung hindi pa rin ma-access ang app, subukan i-restart ang inyong device o i-update ang app. Kung problema pa rin, makipag-ugnayan sa aming support team.

If you can't see your open trading positions, please try the following steps: Make sure you are logged into the correct trading account on your platform (MT4/MT5 or Web Terminal), check that the instruments related to your account type are visible in the 'Market Watch' window (right-click on 'Market Watch', select 'Symbols', choose the instruments you want to trade, click 'Show', then close the window), confirm you are connected to the correct server and that your login details are correct. If some symbols appear greyed out, they might be used for price calculations and can be hidden by right-clicking and selecting 'Hide'. Also, right-click on 'Market Watch' and select 'Show All' to ensure all available instruments are displayed. If you still cannot see your positions, try logging out and logging back in or restarting the platform.

HFM uses Dynamic Leverage which automatically adjusts based on your account equity for risk management. The leverage decreases as your account balance increases: $0-$4,999 = 1:2000, $5,000-$39,999 = 1:1000, $40,000-$99,999 = 1:500, $100,000+ = 1:200. This is done automatically without prior notice to protect both you and the company from excessive risk exposure on larger accounts.

Withdrawals refer to the process of taking money out from your trading account or myHF wallet back to your bank account, card, or e-wallet. You can withdraw funds that are not tied to open trades or margin requirements. To make a withdrawal, log into your myHF area, select 'Withdraw', choose your preferred method, and follow the instructions. Withdrawals are processed within 24 hours, and funds are sent to the same payment method used for deposits.

If your live trading account shows no leverage, this may be because your account has insufficient funds or zero equity. Leverage is automatically applied based on your account equity: $0-$4,999 = 1:2000, $5,000-$39,999 = 1:1000, $40,000-$99,999 = 1:500, $100,000+ = 1:200. Ensure your account is funded to activate leverage. You can also manually change leverage from your myHF area under Trading Accounts > Actions > Change Leverage (limited to 5 changes).

To make a withdrawal, log in to your myHF area (Client Area) and select 'Withdraw'. Choose your preferred withdrawal method and enter the amount. Withdrawals are processed within 24 hours. user: Will deleting one account affect others
standard_answer: Deleting or archiving one trading account will not affect your other trading accounts. Each trading account operates independently, so actions on one account (such as permanently deleting, archiving, or freezing) do not impact other accounts you hold. For example, if you archive your Cent account, your Pro account will remain fully functional. Please note that archived accounts cannot be reactivated later, but your other accounts will continue to operate normally.

To enable your live account, you need to complete the verification process by submitting the required documents: Upload a Proof of Identification (a current, colored scanned copy of your passport, National ID card, or Driving Licence) and a Proof of Address (a Bank Statement or Utility Bill not older than 6 months, showing your name and physical address). Make sure the name on both documents matches exactly. You can upload these documents directly from your myHF area or send them via email to backoffice@hfm.com. Once your documents are verified (usually within 48 hours), your account will be activated.

If the issue persists, please contact our support team or connect to a Live Agent for immediate assistance.

A margin call occurs when your account equity falls below the required margin level for your open positions. This means you need to either deposit more funds or close some positions to maintain adequate margin. You can monitor your margin level in your trading platform. To avoid margin calls, manage your risk carefully and maintain sufficient account balance relative to your position sizes.

Pip value calculation depends on the currency pair, lot size, and your account currency. For most major pairs, 1 pip = 0.0001. The pip value formula is: (Pip in decimal places × Trade Size) / Exchange Rate to Account Currency. You can use our pip calculator on the website or view pip values directly in your trading platform. For assistance with calculations, please contact our Live Agents.

Stop loss helps limit potential losses by automatically closing positions at predetermined levels.

If your live account was disconnected, this could be due to several reasons: Technical issues (network problems, server maintenance, platform updates), account verification issues or incomplete documentation, reaching the maximum limit of 7 live MT4 or 5 live MT5 trading accounts, compliance or regulatory requirements, or account violations. Once a trading account is archived, it cannot be reactivated or moved back from archived status. Archiving is a permanent action that cannot be undone. If you need to continue trading, you will need to create a new trading account through your myHF area by going to Trading Accounts > Open Live Account. If you have reached the maximum number of live accounts, you may need to archive an existing account first to create space for a new one.

If your withdrawal has been debited from your HFM wallet but not yet received in your bank account, this may be due to processing times by your bank or payment provider. You can check your withdrawal status in myHF area under My Wallet > Wallet Actions > Wallet Finances > Withdrawals tab. If the delay continues, send a screenshot of your withdrawal confirmation to deposit@hfm.com for assistance.

user: Take profit hit trade not closed
standard_answer: If your trade has hit the take profit level but did not close automatically, this could be due to a temporary delay or technical issue. Please try the following steps: Refresh your trading platform or log out and log back in, check your internet connection to ensure it is stable, restart your MT4/MT5 platform. If the issue persists, contact our Live Agents for immediate assistance to investigate the matter further and help close the trade if needed.

Trading for your account may be disabled on the server for several reasons, including: Your account might have reached the maximum limit of live trading accounts allowed. In this case, you would need to archive one or more existing accounts to open or activate another. There could be server-related issues or maintenance affecting your account's trading capabilities. Your account status might require verification or there could be restrictions applied by the platform. To resolve this, please try logging out and back in, check if you have exceeded the account limits, or contact support for specific details related to your account status.

To get started with our app and make the most of it, please follow these steps: Register an Account: Open the app and create your myHF account by following the registration prompts. Benefits: With your trading account, you can trade various assets, practice on demo accounts, and manage your funds easily through the app. If you need help with specific features or have questions, feel free to ask!

If you didn't receive a bonus after funding your account, this could be due to several reasons: the deposit may not meet the minimum bonus requirements, your account may not be eligible for the current promotion, or the bonus may have specific terms and conditions. The most common reasons for bonus issues are: Withdrawing deposited funds, as the bonus is also proportionally removed to the amount withdrawn (check promotional terms and conditions for more), Violating bonus terms, which could include specific trading rules or account activity requirements (check promotional terms and conditions for more). For specific details about why your bonus was not received, please check your myHF area or contact our Live Agents directly. They can provide information regarding your specific account and bonus status.

To log in to your account, follow the steps based on your device: For Android: Open your MT4 app, tap the 3 lines menu at the top left, select 'Manage Accounts', tap the + sign at the top right, choose 'Login to an existing account', enter hfmarkets and select the server, enter your trading account number and password, click 'Sign in'. For iPhone: Open your MT4 app, go to 'Settings', tap 'New Account', select 'Login to an existing account', enter hfmarkets and choose the server, enter your trading account number and password, tap 'Sign in'. For MT5 (both Android and iPhone): Open MT5, go to 'Settings', tap 'New Account', select 'Login to an existing account', enter hfmarkets and select the broker server, enter your trading account number and password, tap 'Sign in'. For Web Terminal or PC: Open your MT4 or MT5 platform, click 'File' in the top menu, select 'Login' in your Trade Account section, enter your trading account number and password, choose the server, click 'Login'. If you need further assistance, feel free to ask!

For Web Terminal or PC: Open your MT4 or MT5 platform, click 'File' in the top menu, select 'Login' in your Trade Account section, enter your trading account number and password, choose the server, click 'Login'. If you need further assistance, feel free to ask!

To recover or reset your MT5 trading account password, please follow these steps: - Log in to your myHF area on the website or through the HFM App. - Navigate to My Trading Accounts. - Find the account for which you want to reset the password. - Click the cog wheel symbol under the 'ACTIONS' tab next to your account. - Select Change Password. - Enter a new password that meets the security criteria and click Continue. - You will receive a one-time password (OTP) via your registered email. - Enter the OTP in the provided field and click Confirm to complete the password reset. If you have trouble accessing your myHF area or resetting the password, please contact HF Markets support for further assistance.

To recover or reset your MT5 trading account password, please follow these steps: - Log in to your myHF area on the website or through the HFM App. - Navigate to My Trading Accounts. - Find the account for which you want to reset the password. - Click the cog wheel symbol under the 'ACTIONS' tab next to your account. - Select Change Password. - Enter a new password that meets the security criteria and click Continue. - You will receive a one-time password (OTP) via your registered email. - Enter the OTP in the provided field and click Confirm to complete the password reset. If you have trouble accessing your myHF area or resetting the password, please contact HF Markets support for further assistance.

To withdraw funds from your trading account to a bank account, please make sure that you first transfer the funds from your trading account to the wallet, and then follow these steps: Log in to your myHF area (Client Area). Select the Withdraw option. Choose your preferred withdrawal method, such as a bank transfer. Enter the amount you wish to withdraw. Submit your withdrawal request. If you are facing any issues during the process, please ask to connect to a Live Agent.

user: How to withdraw to bank account
standard_answer: To withdraw funds from your trading account to a bank account, please make sure that you first transfer the funds from your trading account to the wallet, and then follow these steps: Log in to your myHF area (Client Area). As per our Company procedure, we must follow a back to source withdrawal priority procedure, meaning all deposits made via card must be returned (in the same amount) back to the same card. Once those are cleared, you may be able to use online banking methods, upon availability.

Most Recent: always use the newest code you've received, as older ones won't work. New Code: If issues continue, request a new code and use it right away. If you are still having issues, please ask to speak to one of our Live Agents.

Your documents are usually verified within 24-48 hours after submission. Please make sure you have uploaded the required documents correctly: A current, colored scanned copy of your passport or a similar photo ID (National ID card or Driving licence). A recent Proof of Address document (bank statement or utility bill) not older than 6 months, with your name and address clearly visible. You can upload these documents directly in your myHF area or send them via email to backoffice@hfm.com. If it has been more than 48 hours since submission, please check your email for any requests for additional information or contact our support for further assistance.

The delay in commission payout withdrawal is usually due to the processing time needed for your withdrawal request to be reviewed and processed by HFM and the payment processor. This processing time does not include the time it takes for the funds to actually appear in your bank account or e-wallet, which depends on the payment method you selected. All withdrawal requests are typically processed within 24 hours, but the total time for funds to reach you can vary based on your payment method and the payment processor's speed. If you want to cancel a withdrawal request, you can connect to a Live agent immediately, but if the payment processor has already processed it, cancellation may not be possible. For more details on withdrawal options and processing times, you can visit our website under Trading > Pricing > Withdrawal Options.

For Live accounts, we need at least two documents to accept you as an individual client: Proof of Identification - current (not expired) coloured scanned copy (in PDF or JPG format) of your passport. If no valid passport is available, please upload a similar identification document bearing your photo, such as a National ID card or a Driving licence. Proof of Address - a Bank Statement or Utility Bill. Please ensure, however, that documents provided are not older than 6 months and that your name and physical address are clearly displayed. Important Note: The name on the Proof of Identification document must match the name on the Proof of Address document. You can conveniently upload your documents directly from your myHF area; alternatively, you can also scan them and send them to backoffice@hfm.com Your documents will be checked by the verification department within 48 hours. Kindly note, any deposits will be credited to the account only after your documents have been approved and your myHF area is fully activated.

To update your email address registered with your HFM account, please follow these steps: Send a request from your currently registered email address to update your email. Include the new email address you want to use. If you no longer have access to your registered email, send the request from your new email address to the email provided on our Contact Us page. Attach the following for verification: A front and back copy of your registered ID document. A clear photo of yourself holding your registered ID document (both your face and the ID must be fully visible). Confirm your old email address. This process helps us verify your identity and update your email securely.

If you're unable to trade through MT5, please try these troubleshooting steps: Check your internet connection and restart the MT5 platform. Verify you're logged in with the correct trading account number and password. Ensure you have sufficient margin and available balance for trading. Check if your account is fully verified and activated. Confirm the trading instruments are visible in Market Watch (right-click Market Watch > Symbols > Show). If the issue persists, contact our execution team at tradingdesk@hfm.com or Live Agents for technical assistance.

Account settings restrictions can occur due to verification issues, account limits, or specific operational permissions. Common causes include: incomplete account verification, reaching maximum account limits, insufficient margin or balance, or restricted account permissions. To resolve this issue, please connect to a Live Agent who can review your specific account settings and provide personalized assistance to enable the requested operation. They can check your account status, verification level, and help adjust the necessary settings.

They can check your account status, verification level, and help adjust the necessary settings.

To recover or reset your MT5 trading account password, please follow these steps: Log in to your myHF area on the website or through the HFM App. Navigate to My Trading Accounts. Find the account for which you want to reset the password. Click the cog wheel symbol under the 'ACTIONS' tab next to your account. Select Change Password. Enter a new password that meets the security criteria and click Continue. You will receive a one-time password (OTP) via your registered email. Enter the OTP in the provided field and click Confirm to complete the password reset. If you have trouble accessing your myHF area or resetting the password, please contact HF Markets support for further assistance.

To recover or reset your MT5 trading account password, please follow these steps: Log in to your myHF area on the website or through the HFM App. Navigate to My Trading Accounts. Find the account for which you want to reset the password. Click the cog wheel symbol under the 'ACTIONS' tab next to your account. Select Change Password. Enter a new password that meets the security criteria and click Continue. You will receive a one-time password (OTP) via your registered email. Enter the OTP in the provided field and click Confirm to complete the password reset. If you have trouble accessing your myHF area or resetting the password, please contact HF Markets support for further assistance.

To complete your registration for a Live account, ensure you have uploaded: A valid, colored, and current Proof of Identification (passport, national ID, or driving license). A Proof of Address document (bank statement or utility bill not older than 6 months). Make sure the name on both documents matches exactly. You can upload these documents directly in your myHF area or send them to backoffice@hfm.com. Verification usually takes up to 48 hours. If you meant something else, please provide more details so I can assist you better.

A terminated HFM account cannot be reinstated to normal status once it has been closed or archived. If you have archived a trading account, it cannot be reactivated. If your account was closed due to compliance or verification issues, you would need to contact support for specific guidance, but generally, once an account is terminated or closed, it cannot be reopened. If you need further assistance, please reach out to our support team directly.

If you need further assistance, please reach out to our support team directly.

If your HFM account was terminated, it may be due to account closure initiated either by you or due to certain compliance or verification issues. To clarify the exact reason, please check if you have received any email notifications from us regarding the termination. If you wish to close your account yourself, you need to first withdraw all remaining funds and then send a confirmation email from your registered email address stating your request to close the account along with the reason. If you did not request closure, please contact our support team directly for detailed assistance.

If you have not received the funds after a cryptocurrency deposit, please check if the transaction was successful. If it was successful but the funds are not in your myHF account, send a screenshot or confirmation of the transaction to deposit@hfm.com for further assistance. If you want to know about canceling a deposit, please note that once a deposit transaction is successful, it generally cannot be canceled. For immediate help, you can also connect to a Live Agent.
